int cmdCamSetVideoFormat (  ClientData    clientData,
Tcl_Interp *    interp,
int    argc,
char *    argv[]
) 
 

cmdCamSetVideoFormat - implemented under Linux.

Sets image format, argument must be format name (one of):

  • SQCIF - 128x96
  • QSIF - 160x120
  • QCIF - 176x144
  • SSIF - 240x176
  • SIF - 320x240
  • CIF - 352x288
  • VGA - 640x480.

int cmdCamValidFrame (  ClientData    clientData,
Tcl_Interp *    interp,
int    argc,
char *    argv[]
) 
 

cmdCamValidFrame - set valid frame number.

Possible arguments:

  • no argument - returns actual setting,
  • number > 0 - set valid frame on number,
  • number = 0 - set auto detection mode.

int cmdCamVideoFormat (  ClientData    clientData,
Tcl_Interp *    interp,
int    argc,
char *    argv[]
) 
 

cmdCamVideoFormat - Réglage des paramètres de la caméra.

Under Linux it shows a window dialog where you can chose image format.

int cmdCamVideoSource (  ClientData    clientData,
Tcl_Interp *    interp,
int    argc,
char *    argv[]
) 
 

cmdCamVideoSource.

Réglage des paramètres de la caméra

Under Linux it calls ::confCam::confVideoSource command and shows VideoSource window dialog.
